title: What does "res" do as a lookup parameter?
body:
We are not clear on how to use "res"in a lookup query.

For example, what does xx represent in this query? 

    GET /example/rd-lookup-gp?res=xx

I couldn't find text to explain. Is it expected to be the address of a resource, like href or anchor+href ?

title: Is rd-lookup-* optional?
body: The text in section 7 says lookup is optional but the table in section 7 lists two mandatory lookup resource types. I can't find text to explain the difference.

title: lookup: Mention Observe for continuous interest
body:
Observe, ETag and possible future mechanisms are stated to be generally
usable, but phrased as a "like with any other resource", because there
is no need to actually define something new here.

title: Uniqueness scope for `ins`
body:
Within which scope should the `ins` parameter be unique?

The -09 draft (and the restoration PR #11) demands that it SHOULD be unique across all resources with the same `rt` and `d`. That is hard for the individual device to support out of the box short of adding its serial number to everything, and (given it's not a MUST) still insufficient for an RD exporter (eg. to DNS-SD) to use.

In the last meeting, labels for distinguishing two instances in a combined devices came up (two fridge compartments, `ins="upper"` and `ins="lower"`), which would violate that constraint when two fridges are present in one domain.

I'd suggest to either relax the uniqueness requirements and have whoever exports this to DNS-SD deal with the resulting ambiguities[1], or make them strict enough for ins= conflicts to fail early (an absent ins= would be such a conflict too, or is that a free pass to construct an `ins` at will?), and suggest a different mechanism for "upper"/"lower" distinctions (title?).

[1]: For example, as is done in the Z-Wave-IP, see design specification 4.1.2.3: "If several End Point Name and End Point Location entries are identical, the Z/IP RD MUST auto-append unique data to each of the conflicting End Point Names"

title: Drop "base URI" references
body:
All URIs of RD APIs are discovered standalone, and no relative URI or path-appending is required any more. Therefore, the term "Base URIs" and the distinction between "rd-lookup-base" and "lookup-type" in the RD lookup API are obsolete.

This has already been [mentioned on the mailing list](https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/core/7zzSmZK6Od1Rw3vzpaenN4G6otw), and [acked by Peter](https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/core/NCLNlY8N__TCf9UMEq5yF1WxSJs), if I understood his response correctly (which I'm unsure about, thus tagging this for review).

title: Restore ins=/exp=
body:
These commits restore the ins=/exp= definitions dropped after -09, and instead of referencing the DNS-SD mapping chapter, reference the (so far not even uploaded) RD-DNS-SD draft.

There is some confusion between where arguments can be used, but the "what goes where" of the link-format attributes is a separate issue to be tackled.

title: Add JSON or CBOR link format examples
body: As we support the alternative serializations from draft-ietf-core-links-json, I'd like to add at least the numbers in the RD lookup examples.

title: Add "ins" and "exp" link attributes
body:
"ins" (instance ID) is used to differentiate between two links which are otherwise indistinguishable. It is a text value which should be restricted to a maximum 63 octets.

"exp"is an attribute which provides a hint that the link may be exported to other RDs or other discovery services like DNS-SD

title: Describe finding an RD using DNS-SD
body: There should be a well defined way to find an RD using DNS-SD to find an RD. Needs assignment of a well-known record type/value and some text in RD to describe the use of DNS-SD.

title: How does a client get notifications of changes to a RD?
body: It would be good to provide a way for clients to receive notifications upon updates of an RD.

title: Registration update: (invalid) content format
body:
An update to a registrtion resource can happen with different content formats. Probably, 4.15 Unsupported Content Format should be added to the failure modes. (Or in general: How much of common CoAP practice needs to be prescribed for each interface?)

Especially: Is the absence of a content format admissible in the minimal (empty) registration update?

(May affect other interfaces as well.)

title: Review example addresses
body: Addresses should probably be formatted according to [RFC5952](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5952), and I'll need to look into the applicability of the 2001:db8: prefix reserved for documentation on whether addresses should be used from that area.

title: Editorial fixes from 2017-03-16
body: This pull request contains edits to resolve my comments [mailed to the list](https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/core/7zzSmZK6Od1Rw3vzpaenN4G6otw) earlier; these here address the uncontroversial points [already acked by Peter](https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/core/NCLNlY8N__TCf9UMEq5yF1WxSJs).

title: Add draft-ietf-core-etch as normative reference
body: This is needed for the 4.09 error code referenced.

title: Implied ports for con vs. ephemeral ports
body:
There has been confusion about the semantics of an absent `con=` in the presence of transient ports ([1](https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/core/YmfB5VB1uZBrQlZhupgSuw4DXAg) first paragraphs, 5.3 HTTP example).

Proposed solution: more explicit wording about con= being practically required when transient ports are used.

title: Check with reverse-dependencies
body:
I'd like to check whether there are open issues in compatibility with documents that want to cite resource-directory:

* [ ] [pubsub](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-core-coap-pubsub/)
* [x] [lwig-cellular](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-lwig-cellular/): just recommends the mechanism
* [x] [t2trg-rest-iot](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-keranen-t2trg-rest-iot/): just example use in 04; further use expected but nothing written down yet.
* [ ] [alternative-transports](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-silverajan-core-coap-protocol-negotiation/): initial issues addressed (eg. allowing full URIs in con=), check for latest status in progress
* [x] enumerate other users: done using https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-ietf-core-resource-directory/referencedby/ (informative references ignored)
